intro: Stephania fastuosa, commonly known as the mountain stephania, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and can reach heights of up to 2 meters. Its roots are sometimes used in traditional medicine, though its botanical significance lies in its morphology and ecological role. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude habitats.
